title: likely effect of the following order on the matters specified in paragraphs (a) to
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Parent’s Leave and Benefit Act 2019
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Parent’s Leave and Benefit Act 2019 

(Extension of Periods of Leave) Order 2022. 

(2) This Order shall come into operation on 1 July 2022.
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited parent leave benefit act 2019 (extension period leave) order 2022 (2) order shall come operation 1 july 2022

title: likely effect of the following order on the matters specified in paragraphs (a) to
heading: In this Order –
text_raw:
2. 

In this Order – 

“Act of 2021” means the Family Leave and Miscellaneous Provisions Act 2021 
(No. 4 of 2021); 

“Principal Act” means the Parent’s Leave and Benefit Act 2019 (No. 35 of 
2019).
text_norm: 2 order - act 2021 mean family leave miscellaneous provision act 2021 (no 4 2021) principal act mean parent leave benefit act 2019 (no 35 2019)

title: likely effect of the following order on the matters specified in paragraphs (a) to
heading: 3. Section 5(1) (amended by section 26 of the Act of 2021) of the
text_raw:
3. Section 5(1) (amended by section 26 of the Act of 2021) of the 

Principal Act is amended by the substitution of “7 weeks” for “5 weeks”.
text_norm: 3 section 5(1) (amended section 26 act 2021) principal act amended substitution 7 week 5 week

title: likely effect of the following order on the matters specified in paragraphs (a) to
heading: 4. Section 16(1) (amended by section 29 of the Act of 2021) of the
text_raw:
4. Section 16(1) (amended by section 29 of the Act of 2021) of the 

Principal Act is amended by the substitution of “7 weeks” for “5 weeks”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 8th July, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [333] 3 

The Minister for Social Protection consents to the foregoing Order. 
 29 June 2022 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 
 Minister for Social Protection. 

The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the foregoing 
Order 
 29 June 2022 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 
 Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

29 June, 2022. 

RODERIC O'GORMAN, 

Minister for Children, Equality, Disability, Integration and 
Youth.
